name: Semantic Agency Axiom
intent: Define conditions under which semantic gradients generate agency-like behavior.
constraints: A semantic potential U: R \-\> ℝ exists, with gradient ∇U defining preferred semantic directions.
The representation dynamics are given by ṙ \= \-∇U(r) \+ η(t), where η is a noise or perturbation term.
A proto-agent is a system whose trajectories converge to non-trivial attractor sets A ⊆ R.
Semantic agency arises when attractor sets A maximize an internal semantic coherence functional J under the given dynamics.
